artist: Artist: Attributed to Torii Kiyomasu ll
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
medium: Woodblock print (urushi-e); ink on paper, with hand-applied color and nikawa
text: Several prints of eagles and hawks signed by or attributed to Torii Kiyomasu I and II exist. Many of the designs are similar to those appearing in the book "Past and Present Writings about Falcons: The Clenched Fist" (Kokon taka no sho: Nigiri kobushi 古今鷹之書　仁義理古武士), a book on falconry with 48 images, published in 1687. See Hillier: The Art of the Japanese Book, vol. 1. p. 131 for an example.
title: Raptor Capturing a Crane in Flight
